title: Web-Based Tool-Assisted Mathematical Problem-Solving Project

context.prior_knowledge: Requirement of intermediate theoretical background and practical experience
context.additional_context: A teaching competency enhancement program for pre-service or in-service teachers. Designs learning activities using Web 2.0 tools in a smartphone-centric, limited-technology environment.

learning_goals: Learners can utilize web-based collaborative tools (e.g., Padlet, Jamboard) with over 80% accuracy for solving math problems.
Learners submit project outcomes that creatively solve real-life math problems using mobile apps.
Learners repeat the problem-solving process three or more times while sharing digital feedback with peers.

resources: Google Forms or TypeForm Survey Tools
Kahoot! or Quizizz Formative Assessment Tools
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
